text: Ask about Axana's whereabouts with Aglaea and the others

title: Mission Description
content: After discovering Anaxagoras had fled to theCouncil of Elders, Aglaea rushed to Dawncloud to confront the Council about theCoreflames.The scholar appears to share the same condition as (Trailblazer). This might hold the key to(his/her)salvation.

text: In the meantime...

speaker: Aglaea
line: I have news from Hyacine and Dan Heng . Anaxa might be trying to do something with Kephale 's divine body.

speaker: Phainon
line: Kephale ? But what could Anaxa want...? Is the Council of Elders going to sit around and let such a sacrilegious act unfold?

speaker: Aglaea
line: That is not possible.

speaker: Aglaea
line: He is indeed "the Great Performer," capable of fooling anyone and everyone with his tricks.

speaker: Phainon
line: I... I'm sorry.

speaker: Aglaea
line: No need for guilt, for this is good news to us. The Council of Elders has found themselves a traitorous ally. Anaxa's ambitious desires will be something we can exploit.

speaker: Aglaea
line: What we should be doing now is to keep our eyes peeled for whichever trickery Caenis is up to and react accordingly to thwart her plans.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Being Okhema 's political center, the Demigod Council holds just as much significance as the Vortex of Genesis . Someday, after my duty is over, this site will take the place of the battlefield where you hunt gods, become the next challenge you ought to overcome...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Till then, it's best to get used to this place as soon as possible.

text: We will be waiting here for your good news.
Come find us anytime you need something.

speaker: Strolling Councilor
line: Preposterous! The Chrysos Heirs only have their standing because of the Council of Elders. How dare they trample over it!

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Wow, these people are shooting daggers with their eyes...)

speaker: Krateros
line: It's been a while.

text: Hello, Oleg of Amphoreus .

children.speaker: Krateros
children.line: ...What is that supposed to mean? Is this really the sort of person that the young lord praised as a ferocious warrior?

text: But we've never met.

children.speaker: Krateros
children.line: That's fine. I recognize you. The young lord has nothing but good words about your courage.

speaker: Phainon
line: It has indeed been some time, Lord Krateros. What brings you here in such haste...?

speaker: Krateros
line: Shh...! Keep it down.

speaker: Krateros
line: Be more vigilant. See those duplicitous dogs over there? They do the dirty work for Caenis.

speaker: Krateros
line: I've already ordered my people to hold them back, but we should still lay low... Unless you're itching for a bloody fight to get a workout in.

speaker: Phainon
line: My bad. So, did something happen?

speaker: Krateros
line: Did you hear thunderclaps last night?

text: It would be hard not to notice thunderclaps in broad daylight.
No, I'm a heavy sleeper.
Hurray, it's Acheron ! Someone's coming to save us!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ▶ ( He's / She's ) been through a lot lately. Please pardon ( him. / her. ) Can you tell us more about these thunderclaps?

speaker: Krateros
line: Thunderclaps are beacon signals of Strife. They are a message from the young lord. He threw a spear bearing several words at Okhema.

speaker: Mydei
line: "Watch out. The Flame Reaver is back."

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I guessed as much. We didn't actually kill them back at the Kremnos arena .

speaker: Krateros
line: I figured this is something you would want to know. We Kremnoans never back down from a fight, so if you plan to take that thing down in a battle, reach out to me anytime.

speaker: Phainon
line: You have my gratitude. I will let Aglaea know about this right away.

speaker: Krateros
line: Remind her to be on her toes while you're at it. That vicious Caenis has been unusually active lately.

speaker: Krateros
line: Those lackeys she keeps undercover have been going in and out of the city a lot more frequently these days. Some even seem to be getting Kremnoans to defect to the Council...

speaker: Crowd
line: Get off the stage! Scram!

speaker: Phainon
line: That's...

speaker: Krateros
line: Hmph. Looks like you can see it for yourself.

speaker: Phainon
line: We should get back. Thank you for the intel, Lord Krateros.

text: Return to the Demigod Council and inform Aglaea about things

title: Step Description
content: After discovering Anaxagoras had fled to the Council of Elders, Aglaea rushed to Dawncloud to confront the Council.Deliver Mydei's warning to Aglaea.

text: (Approach the two councilors to the left of the bridge, idle text)

speaker: Nosy Councilor
line: The Council of Elders has long fallen into disgrace.

speaker: Steadfast Councilor
line: I want to support the Council of Elders.

text: (Listen to the two councilors to the left of the bridge, optional)

speaker: Nosy Councilor
line: Haha, someone trampled right over the master's flower bed, yet the master only fumes in silence. Oopsie, there goes the reputation of the Council of Elders.

speaker: Steadfast Councilor
line: Whose side am I on? Why, I'm all for the Council of Elders to reclaim their authority, of course!

text: (Approach the three councilors on the bridge, idle text)

speaker: Careful Councilor
line: Hush, the Chrysos Heir is here.

speaker: Pious Councilor
line: On behalf of the Chrysos Heir, I plead for forgiveness.

text: (Listen to the three councilors on the bridge, optional)

speaker: Careful Councilor
line: They're here. The Chrysos Heirs are here.

speaker: Elderly Councilor
line: I should've gone back home to fetch a sacrificial vessel, some floral crowns, and frankincense to burn and offer...

speaker: Pious Councilor
line: O Titans, please forgive these arrogant and self-conceited heroes.

text: (While crossing the bridge)

speaker: Lygus
line: By Kephale and Talanton above, as the Theoros, I have observed...

speaker: Lygus
line: ▶ Virtuous citizens of Okhema, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae and (Trailblazer) the outlander are heading toward us!

text: (Approach the stage)

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea! What happened here?

speaker: Aglaea
line: I know about the poisonous fangs of that kingsnake through the golden threads. In the past, I would be confident about keeping her in check, but... I admit I am now unable to do so.

speaker: Phainon
line: What do you mean?

speaker: Aglaea
line: It is no longer about eloquence or arguments. I have been a demigod for far too long that I hardly have any humanity left. Before I realized it, I have become no different from these hypocrites, no longer capable of relating to the people.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This has come a lot sooner than I expected, but perhaps it is time. I need you to step up, Phainon, in order for me to retreat behind the scenes.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes, this is my duty, but...

speaker: Aglaea
line: It is far easier for the Council of Elders to fool many than just fool one person. Their so-called "more support" is no more than a ruse to distribute power using words instead of lances.

speaker: Aglaea
line: There is no glory in winning this debate, but that makes having respect for "humans" so much more priceless. Phainon, you are a Chrysos Heir without flaw, capable of relating deeply with humans...

speaker: Phainon
line: I appreciate what you've taught me, Aglaea. I hope we'll live up to your expectations and win this debate.

speaker: Caenis
line: Pfft. Hahaha...

speaker: Caenis
line: You've done well, Lord Callictis. Let me take over and personally close this debate for today.

speaker: Caenis
line: Dearest councilors, let it be known that I sorely miss the blissful times portrayed in lyrical poems. Back then, Amphoreus was home to nearly a thousand cities — each with their own local faith — while gods walked the earth and shared close bonds with humans.

speaker: Caenis
line: Yet in the present, people from all over are forced to leave their homeland, to seek refuge in the holy city, where they hope to rest under Kephale 's protection. All of us have long been in the same boat, with no way out of this plight.

speaker: Caenis
line: We didn't have a choice in the past, but now... the Council of Elders brings to the table a new possibility. All I have left is one question for you:

speaker: Caenis
line: Would you rather strive toward the unheard-of "Era Nova," or return to the prosperous "Era Chrysea" of our past? Make your choice!

speaker: Caenis
line: Now, which of the two would lead mortals to an ideal future?

text: No hesitation! I stand by "Era Nova"!

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ "Era Nova" is a path of salvation the gods promised. We should not have doubts in the Flame-Chase Journey.

text: If it's possible to bring "Era Chrysea" back...

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ But how are we supposed to send Amphoreus back to "Era Chrysea"?

speaker: Phainon
line: We all know that "Era Chrysea" is a thing of the past, Lady Caenis. Please enlighten me — how does the Council of Elders plan to turn back time?

speaker: Caenis
line: Let the Three Titans of Calamity be born and Era Chrysea is nevermore, but bring demise to those Titans and Era Chrysea will descend upon us again.

speaker: Caenis
line: Know that the Council of Elders is never one to make empty promises. Look at who we have on our side...

speaker: Caenis
line: Anaxagoras, one of the Grove's Seven Sages, and Castorice, Aidonia 's "Goddess of Death"!

speaker: Caenis
line: With the help of these two heroes, I can promise all of you that "Era Chrysea" will exist once more!

speaker: A Member of the Council of Elders
line: Aren't they Chrysos Heirs? They're supporting the Council of Elders instead?

speaker: Another Member of the Council of Elders
line: Hmph, it's clear from the start that these heroes do not get along well in their group. All the more proof that Aglaea isn't fit to speak on behalf of every Chrysos Heir. I am in favor of "Era Chrysea"!

speaker: A Member of the Council of Elders
line: Era Chrysea, Era Chrysea!

speaker: Members of the Council of Elders
line: Era Chrysea, Era Chrysea!

speaker: Phainon
line: Castorice? Why are you standing over there...

speaker: Aglaea
line: You've finally arrived, Anaxa. So have you... Cas.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Don't worry, Aglaea. While I know that you have many queries, could you continue to converse like how "the citizens normally do"?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Tell me, dear citizens...

speaker: Anaxa
line: If we successfully retrieve and return Thanatos ' Coreflame without anyone passing the Death Titan's trial, what would happen next?

speaker: Caenis
line: The answer is simple: We will have a chance to rid the world of "death" and bring Amphoreus back to an era when all beings live forever... We'll usher in a new future that will be entirely different from "the Flame-Chase Journey"!

speaker: discussing fervently
line: The members of the Council of Elders are .

speaker: Phainon
line: Your proposal is much too idealistic. As long as the black tide still exists, how can we go back to the old days?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Remember what I previously said? Kephale 's Coreflame is guarded by the secret power of the Council of Elders. Plus, Phagousa 's water curtain will be able to block out any external perceptions.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Tell me, dear citizens: Have any of you ever seen even a glimpse of the threat that this person is talking about anywhere within the walls of this majestic holy city?

text: But this place will become the Flame Reaver's target sooner or later!

children.speaker: Caenis
children.line: Oh? Could it be that you heard that from the Flame Reaver themself?

text: Isn't this just survivorship bias?

children.speaker: Caenis
children.line: If we eliminate death, then there's no need for us to fear that Flame Reaver, right?

speaker: Caenis
line: Citizens, let's loudly sing the blessed hymn: "O beautiful old world, where are you now? O legendary Era Chrysea, return to the mortal realm!"

speaker: Anaxa
line: After the destruction of the Three Titans of Calamity, the Flame-Chase Journey will have to end!

speaker: cheering in excitement
line: The members of the Council of Elders are .

speaker: Phainon
line: This is bad. The masses are now totally riled up...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Anaxa, pray tell: Everything that you've mentioned hinges on the premise that we can find Thanatos 's existence, right?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Thank you, Lady Aglaea, for still caring about this city. However, dear citizens, we are truly fortunate and blessed...

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...For Castorice, Aidonia's "Goddess of Death," will surely find Thanatos under my guidance!

speaker: Phainon
line: What...!?

speaker: Caenis
line: With that, I solemnly promise that the Coreflame Lady Castorice brings back will be personally managed by the Council of Elders.

speaker: Caenis
line: Thereafter, if we are able to garner the support of all of you at the citizens' assembly, we shall spare no effort in ensuring that the Era Chrysea will return to our world once again!

speaker: cheering in excitement
line: The members of the Council of Elders are .

speaker: Lygus
line: With the balance shattered, the result is clear. By Kephale and Talanton above, as the Theoros, I have observed...

speaker: Lygus
line: Okhema has chosen her destiny. The issue up for discussion at this citizens' assembly shall be modified to the "Suspension of the Flame-Chase Journey." This resolution shall be put up on the Wall of Heroes such that all citizens are aware of the city's way forward.

speaker: cheering in excitement
line: The members of the Council of Elders are .

speaker: Anaxa
line: Aglaea, dear Aglaea... What has caused your heart to soften? You also don't seem to be as quick-witted as before?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Wag your tongue as much as you like. Since the Flame-Chase Journey has been preordained by the prophecy, our failure has never been on the cards.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Well then, I guess we'll find out if that's true at the citizens' assembly.

text: Lygus announces the conclusion of the debate, and the attendees part ways...
Speak to Castorice and learn about what happened

title: Step Description
content: As Castorice and Anaxagoras back the Council of Elders' plan to "return to Era Chrysea," "pausing the Flame-Chase Journey" has become a matter for the citizens' assembly.Let's hear why Castorice publicly "abandoned" the Flame-Chase Journey. There must be more to this story.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Castorice... What's going on?)

text: (Talk to Castorice)

speaker: Aglaea
line: Well, it seems that when I sent you to look for Anaxa, I unintentionally facilitated your partnership with him instead?

speaker: Castorice
line: My apologies, everyone. I know that you have many questions to ask me. I will answer them to the best of my knowledge.

speaker: Aglaea
line: In that case, please tell us as much as you can.

text: What happened when you went to look for Anaxa?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...A past that was both long and heavy.

text: Hold on. I'm not ready.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ I will wait for you. This matter is of great consequence... and ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer) should hear the entire story from beginning to end.

text: (Talk to Castorice again)

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), are you ready now?

text: What happened when you went to look for Anaxa?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...A past that was both long and heavy.

text: Hold on. I'm not ready.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ I will wait for you. This matter is of great consequence... and ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer) should hear the entire story from beginning to end.

speaker: Anaxa
line: The reason I say this is as I've mentioned earlier: The answer was hidden in my journey unto death.

speaker: Castorice
line: Anaxa... you were in the nether realm?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Yes — I am but a living dead man now — but that's not important. What truly matters is — I overheard a conversation between heroes.

text: The final destination of Polyxia and that Castorice's destiny will reveal Thanatos's whereabouts...
